description.narrative: Our Voices Our Futures (OVOF) will use capacity-building and convenings among feminist movements to strengthen and build movements within countries and across regions, while also link feminist movements to relevant actors, such as internet rights’ movements, Dutch allies and progressive policymakers. OVOF believes in strengthening movements from within, to create more inclusive, powerful and resilient movements. To influence laws and policies at national and international levels, OVOF sees this as the only sustainable mitigation strategy in relation to the increasing power of anti-rights and anti-gender forces.

title.narrative: Mainstream women’s, human rights and feminist organisations increasingly work with structurally silenced women and their organisations to pursue a rights based agenda and advocate for SSW rights.

Number of initiatives developed by mainstream women's, human rights and feminist organisations and activists to strengthen the presence of SSW to participate in global, national and local policy and legal spaces.

comment.narrative: As part of the 16 days of activism against gbv, to include ssw more into this global campaign and give visibility to ssw in the Netherlands and internationally, WO=MEN published 6 interviews/ stories with WHRDs - members and partners of OVOF in Uganda, Kenya, India, Bangladesh and Honduras - to highlight their realities and messages.
